website_summaries.verdict: The Planar Helium is a beautifully designed 27-inch touch-screen monitor featuring 20-point progressive capacitive touch, MVA panel technology, and a nice selection of ports.

customer_reviews.title: Move the controls on the next model, please.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using it as a touch screen mixer for audio recording. It works well, but 3 stars for being a little slow to react and for the idiotic placement of the power button and menu controls, which are also touch sensitive and impossible to avoid. I'll replace it with another brand eventually, but it works for now.
customer_reviews.author: Scottro

customer_reviews.title: Great device. Incorrect description.
customer_reviews.text: Great clarity, brightness, volume, and touch response. Well built. Nice thin bezel. Lost a star because the description is incorrect and the controls are touch instead of tactile push. This does NOT come with Helium stand and is NOT a USB 3.0 hub and does NOT have DVI input. The stand is a kick out single hinge as shown in the main image. Still worked well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Sue

customer_reviews.title: Touchscreen feature will not work with windows 7
customer_reviews.text: I bought 15 of these for my business and the touch screen will not work on any of the computers that I installed them on. There are not any drivers online for this model monitor, Planar support is worthless. All of the computers were windows 7 which is supported by this monitor, changed settings in window to try to accommodate for the touchscreen feature and nothing worked. Basically we spent 3k on glorified 22” monitors.
customer_reviews.author: KALEY AND SHAHAM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value and quality
customer_reviews.text: wow!! what a great value. this monitor has a great picture, auto on an off when connected or computer sleeps, and a really nice price, touch screen works well. you'll need to furnish your own cable for the actual monitor (HDMI, VGA, etc.), but the USB and audio cables are included. I am using it with an MS SurfacePro with HDMI I was pleasantly surprised how good this monitor is. be sure to follow the instructions carefully, but once set up, its terrific.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Excellent monitor for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I have two of the PCT2235 (22" with Helium stand). Both are mounted on clamp arms. I really like everything about this monitor - the built-in stand, the low-profile bezel, the built-in speakers...the display is very good quality, and everything works well with Windows 10. Planar has been around for awhile. They make technology designed for commercial use, and I've had generally good experiences with other products of theirs. This is definitely a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: Terrible pixel blinking - unfixable - DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: This monitor had CONSTANT blinking of rows and rows of pixels all over the screen. There are about 4-5 suggested fixes for issues akin to this online. I tried all of them. One of them (changing color balance) removed about 20% of it, but that's entirely unacceptable. I returned this and bought an ASUS touchscreen monitor for less money (a bit smaller though), and it's perfect in all the ways. The one good thing I can say about this monitor (if you're lucky enough that yours would actually work without strobe-light pixelation) is the stand. The stand is the best I've ever seen, but that's simply not enough as I don't LOOK at the stand! : P
customer_reviews.author: Shelley DeMaison

customer_reviews.title: Works great, no auto power off.
customer_reviews.text: Im using this as the eternal monitor connected to my Surface dock. It works great (I dont use the touch screen) but the one thing I was surprised by is that the monitor does not power off automatically where it has no signal - like most other monitors. When I undock, I have to remember to hit the power button or I will walk back in the room later I see the screen with the "no signal" showing. Not a deal breaker and otherwise would have been 5 star. Well worth the minor annoyance to have a compact screen that does not take up too much desk real estate.
customer_reviews.author: F. Rizzo

customer_reviews.title: Works for Samsung dex
customer_reviews.text: I got this monitor strictly for Samsung dex and was disappointed to find out the touch screen doesnt work in dex mode. A question was asked about dex confirming this so I was set to send it back until I saw another user working the touchscreen through usb in windows 10. I have a 3in1 dongle adapter purchased from Amazon that has hdmi usb type c and usb so I decided to just try the usb port with the provided cord and the touchscreen activated and is working flawlessly. Glad I experimented before sending back because I really like this monitor
customer_reviews.author: Mikeb

customer_reviews.title: Finally got touch fully working with Raspberry Pi!
customer_reviews.text: PCT2235 I used this with a raspberry pi. I was quite frustrated at first. It was not releasing the touch and I had lots of weirdness. Screen was beautiful though. I found the solution to my issue and wanted to post for others. Edit /boot/config.txt and add usbhid.mousepoll=0 to the end, then reboot. It works fantastic now and I am super happy with my purchase. Note that the VESA mount screw holes are fairly shallow. You may need washers, spacers, or shorter screws if mounting. Bonus you don’t have to remove the stand as it folds flat.
customer_reviews.author: jblues

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: included cables were way too long for VESA mounted mini pc, but otherwise its not a bad touch screen monitor. I do not find myself touching the power button like other reviewers at all. I run Windows 10 in tablet mode and its quite responsive. No gaming will be done on here so I cannot comment on that. Looks professional and fits nicely in our kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: xP.1337

customer_reviews.title: Not 22" but rather 19"
customer_reviews.text: Love the touch screen monitor, with caveats. The touch screen is responsive and surprisingly fast. Picture quality is decent for the price-point. The monitor is not 22"; it is 19" (plus a few centimeters).The stand is wonkie. You need a riser to help elevate it reducing neck and back strain. Don't like the control buttons are on the underside right of the monitor, so if you don't have a riser you are lifting the monitor to tap the controls (off, resolution, etc.). These issues lead to a star reduction.
customer_reviews.author: Thankful Grateful Blessed

customer_reviews.title: 10 days over my return window and it stopped accepting HDMI
customer_reviews.text: I liked it fine enough for where I bought it for my small business. Not a great monitor re: image but fine for it's purpose, touchscreen was nice. 40 days after purchase, it keeps saying 'no signal' when my HDMI from my computer was plugged in. I tried 2 other HDMI cables including one recently purchased, and tested the HDMI port and cable to another monitor which worked, so I know it's not the cable OR the HDMI port on the computer that aren't working. I have just started trying to contact the company for service we shall see where we get.
customer_reviews.author: veero

customer_reviews.title: No More Wrist Pain /Carpal Tunnel
customer_reviews.text: This touchscreen solved all my wrist issues. I work from home and do a ton of copying/pasting daily and tried so many different mouses (mice?) but my wrist hurt with every one. Bought this along with a monitor stand and no more wrist pain from using the mouse! Best investment ever! I have a Windows i3 operating system (Dell) and this monitor did not work using the HDMI port but worked using the vga cord which is fine since my computer accepts both.
customer_reviews.author: butterfly

customer_reviews.title: Lost all touch screen capabilities 2 times in less than a few hours
customer_reviews.text: If you just want an extra monitor you can use with your finger not a bad touch screen. However, if you want to use any kind of stylist to on it get something different. I returned mine because after connecting it the screen started to tweek out and had to be unplugged and replugged in to get it to work again. After this happened a 2nd time in less then a few hours I wasn't going to risk it just failing on me all together and ended up returned it today. I had it less then 24hrs before all of these issue occurred.
customer_reviews.author: J. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great touch screen for Linux
customer_reviews.text: Used this for an Arch linux IoT controller interface. Through a variety of software I was able to achieve complete control via touch- no keyboard or mouse. Touch is accurate and worked out of the box. Biggest con: the power/menu buttons are also touch-based and sometimes react when you do not intend. Its easy enough to stay away from that screen edge, so not a deal breaker. What I'd like to see in a future version: Physical buttons on the back. Separate 12V/24V power supply, thinner/lighter. It would have been extremely handy to be able to power this off DC instead of AC in my application (off grid automation).
customer_reviews.author: S. Serbousek

customer_reviews.title: Received a blemished product

Naturally. this is disappointing because I paid full price for an unused product. I can't comment on longevity however since this is the first day utilizing the replacement monitor.

customer_reviews.title: Great for old people.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 83 year old father who was having trouble manipulating the mouse on his computer for accurate control. Which reminds me, I need to get him a bigger toilet. Anyway, ya, it makes it very easy for him to get around on his computer these days which is a feat in and of itself, considering at his age his first computer was an abacus. But, definitely a good purchase for a touch screen.
customer_reviews.author: Dude

customer_reviews.title: This screen is great.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used the touch aspect much but when I have it has worked perfectly with great accuracy. The image is quality and I have been playing Modern Warfare on it and haven't had any problems with low speeds. Would highly recommend!

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous and responsive!

Now have a full all-in-one Windows 10 machine with excellent touch capability. Speakers are sufficient although might not be loud enough to hear Netflix from across the room. The only complaint I have is the monitor control buttons are also capacitive and, aside from the power one, don't light up. It makes changing the settings without a flashlight to make out the labels somewhat bothersome. Still a great buy for the price and functionality, and bonus unobtrusive look. Fun to pair with LCARS 47 and eDex-UI!

customer_reviews.title: Very nice no issues so far

For people that don't know how to set this up make sure u connect everything properly and go to Control Panel\All Control Panel Items \ Tablet PC Settings, click Setup and press Enter until the white box is on your touch monitor then touch the screen and you are ready to go.

The agent also informed me that the description is actually an ad for a different product that I mistook for the actual item, despite getting the exact model number listed in that description. The monitor is fine otherwise. 1 star because that's the only thing that will get noticed.
